text: If you took away all pain, if everyone lived forever, everything would be bland, flat and boring; there would be no reason for art, music, newspapers, love because we would all be in a mono state of happiness.

author: Simon Cowell
text: I am quite miserable because I'm never satisfied with what I've got. You're always looking for that next high, and that is what I would define as happiness.

author: Heraclitus
text: Our envy always lasts longer than the happiness of those we envy.

author: Stephen Fry
text: But happiness is no respecter of persons.

author: Bobby Davro
text: The measure of success is happiness and peace of mind.

author: Milton Berle
text: Money can't buy you happiness, but it helps you look for it in a lot more places.

author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
text: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.

text: The word 'happiness' always bothered me, partly because it was scientifically unwieldy and meant a lot of different things to different people, and also because it's subjective.

author: Franz Kafka
text: In theory there is a possibility of perfect happiness: To believe in the indestructible element within one, and not to strive towards it.

author: Maeve Binchy
text: We have to make our own happiness, and we have to make our own decisions and play the hand that is dealt to us.

author: Ariel Gore
text: I think there are different kinds of happiness. We know when we're happy a lot of the time, but then there are those moments that have more of an afterglow, when the happiness has more depth.

author: Daisaku Ikeda
text: The gratification of desire is not happiness.

author: Amy Lowell
text: Happiness, to some, elation; Is, to others, mere stagnation.

text: It's up to you to be responsible for how you feel if you're not happy. Your happiness lies in your hands. You can't rely on a man to make you happy or complete you. That starts with you.

author: George Orwell
text: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness.

author: Gary Vaynerchuk
text: People are chasing cash, not happiness. When you chase money, you're going to lose. You're just going to. Even if you get the money, you're not going to be happy.

text: I know nothing worth the living for but usefulness and the service of my fellow-creatures. The only object I pursue is to increase, as far as lies in my power, the quantity of their knowledge and goodness and happiness.

author: Saint Augustine
text: Indeed, man wishes to be happy even when he so lives as to make happiness impossible.

author: Brene Brown
text: I've learned that men and women who are living wholehearted lives really allow themselves to soften into joy and happiness. They allow themselves to experience it.

text: Romance and novel paint beauty in colors more charming than nature, and describe a happiness that humans never taste. How deceptive and destructive are those pictures of consummate bliss!

text: Making money is a happiness. And that's a great incentive. Making other people happy is a super-happiness.

text: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.

text: Keep well; that is the half of wisdom and of happiness.

author: Bil Keane
text: A hug is like a boomerang - you get it back right away.

author: David A. Bednar
text: Obedience to the law of chastity will increase our happiness in mortality and make possible our progress in eternity.

text: To be perfectly happy it does not suffice to possess happiness, it is necessary to have deserved it.

text: To play someone who is who they are because of the happiness and contentedness that they've known in their life is interesting because of sort of how banal it is.

text: Happiness held is the seed; Happiness shared is the flower.

text: Sorrow happens, hardship happens, the hell with it, who never knew the price of happiness, will not be happy.

author: Michael J. Fox
text: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.

author: Michael Novak
text: Love is not a feeling of happiness. Love is a willingness to sacrifice.

text: Happiness: a way station between too little and too much.
